item.title: Finally Switched to Hugo
item.description: I have been looking into using Hugo for a long time. Finally managed to make the transition. Also I decided not to use a ready made theme and created my simple layout and CSS using Skeleton as my CSS framework.

item.title: PASV ports in FTP
item.description: I was looking to simulate an embedded device for testing and looking into FTP server implementations a simple bitwise operations question popped up: the way PASV command is standardized requires TCP port numbers to be transferred in two octets represented as integers.

item.title: RSA Encryption and Decryption on the Web
item.description: If you cannot enable SSL for whatever reason, you might still want to encrypt your sensitive information (such as passwords) over the wire. In this post I tried to put together a solution with working examples from various languages to make the client server communication secure using public cryptography with RSA.

item.title: Lightweight Cache Manager for .Net
item.description: Simple cache manger came out of a need to get rid of some bulky libraries to do the simple caching of data. It’s only a couple of classes and easy to just copy-paste into your project.

item.title: Simple logging for ASP.NET Web API clients
item.description: This is a quick and dirty example of how you can enable a simple form of logging for clients using ASP.NET Web API. I used log4net and an extremely simple controller to achieve this.

item.title: Back to blogging with Jekyll on Github
item.description: It’s been a while since I posted any entries. I have been quite busy with stuff and so on (standard excuses). Now my blog is back on-line thanks to a super service provided by Github: Github Pages and the awesome project Jekyll: A static site generation tool.

item.title: MySqlException: Unable to connect to any of the specified MySQL hosts
item.description: Usually in batch type of MySql client code you might have seen this exception before: MySqlException: Unable to connect to any of the specified MySQL hosts (or similar, this one is specific to MySql .Net client)
